nav.div: Chula Vista Elementary School District » News » What's New » Modified Procedures for Board Meetings

div.div: Modified Procedures Announced for Board of Education Meetings

img.alt: This is the image for the news article titled Modified Procedures Announced for Board of Education Meetings
img.p: The Chula Vista Elementary School District (CVESD) is committed to ensuring the health and safety of our entire learning community. Because of the current “stay home” order related to the COVID-19 pandemic and consistent with current state and federal guidance, it has been determined that allowing in-person attendance at CVESD Board of Education meetings is not in the best interest of the community. Therefore, our Board meetings will be conducted virtually and streamed until state and federal guidance allow in-person meetings to resume. As always, the Board meeting agenda is posted online at www.cvesd.org.
img.h4: Please note that the time of the April 22, 2020, meeting has been changed to 3:30 p.m.
img.h2: How to Watch Board of Education Meetings
img.p: Anyone with an internet connection can view our Board meeting live stream. To watch the live stream of the April 22, 2020 meeting, click the link below.

In accordance with Brown Act, the Board offers an opportunity for the public to provide comments. If you wish to address the Board on any agenda or non-agenda item please complete the form accessible below no later than 9 am on April 22. Your comments will be read by a District staff member at the appropriate time during the meeting. The Board of Education will accept public communications via:

a.title: Click here to access form in English

h4.a: Request to Be Heard form in English

a.title: Click here to access form in Spanish
